chunk: clear your lead side and stop pushing off your trail side for a better golf swing [Music]
so guys i often get asked should i feel like my golf swing is pushing and turning with my trail side
or should i feel like i'm using my lead side to turn out of the way and sling the golf club or tow it around the corner
and my answer to this question is a fairly simple one it all goes back to just life in general i find that everything in life is better
when led not pushed a good example is a boat towing a skier
or a trailer a truck pulling a trailer have you ever seen a truck push a trailer i have never seen that yet
trailers work better when they're pulled this is a trailer or a skier it does better when pulled out of the way versus
being pushed okay so let's let's get into how we go about doing that so in our golf swing what we
want to feel is we don't want to feel like we are pushing it's like
throwing or hitting i know when we throw a ball it is done with my trail hand but the thing that puts energy into my
trail hand is not me pushing with my trail side it's actually me using my lead side i actually i pitched
at one point in time in my life and i used my left arm to get the system moving get my my chest
and ribs moving which put energy into my arm that is how i see the golf swing the golf swing
much of it's controlled with our trail arm that can i feel like my trail arm can control the face control the loft but i feel like the energy is put into
the system more with my lead side turning out of the way just like hitting a baseball or throwing a
baseball let's break this down backswing down swinging and all the different sequences that are happening so as we're
getting things going i'm going to use my left my left leg to shift my force into my trail side as
my body begins to wind so as my body winds up my trail leg actually braces and starts to push into the ground
which keeps me from wandering off center and at the same time my torso so my is winding i'm feeling a big stretch
across the obliques here in my trail side and i'm feeling a little bit of slack and crunch in my lead side so you'll be able to see
from this angle as i turn there's this little rounded right here crunched so i'm definitely left bent but i don't feel any slack
over here in the right side i feel like the left side is slacked it's loose the right side is being stretched and loaded up
then as i transition i land into my left side and now my left side feels like it's pulling up and around in my right side
is actually slack it's loose it doesn't feel like it's if it was driving it would be really tight i feel like
my left side is pulling up and around the corner and my my trail side is kind of loosened up
it's not driving anymore so it's stretch this way stretch this way so the back swing is more of a
right-sided i'm pushing with my right leg i'm winding up the right side of the system the downswing i land and now i'm
pushing with my left leg and using the left side of my body to turn around the corner in the back swing it's right-sided the
downswing is left-sided so both directions i'm towing the golf club i'm towing the system i'm not pushing with my left side in the back
swing and pushing with my right side in the downswing it's the opposite i'm pulling my right side out of the way and i'm pulling my left side out of the
way so hopefully this added a little clarity to the subject remember in life everything is better when led
or pulled along don't try to push people to do things don't try to push the golf club and you'll be happier so if you like
